name: Mexican Street Corn Dip
description: This versatile street corn dip is easy to make and is always one of the first things to disappear from the table.
recipeIngredient: 3 cups corn kernels ((fresh, frozen, or canned))
1 teaspoon chili powder ((I used chipotle powder))
2 tablespoons Cotija cheese ((Feta is a good alternative))

recipeInstructions.text: Saute the corn in a dollop of oil over medium-high heat until cooked, approximately 5-8 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Saute the corn in a dollop of oil over medium-high heat until cooked, approximately 5-8 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, mix together 3 tablespoons of mayonnaise, 1 teaspoon chili powder, and the juice of one lime in a bowl
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, mix together 3 tablespoons of mayonnaise, 1 teaspoon chili powder, and the juice of one lime in a bowl

recipeInstructions.text: Add cooked corn to the bowl and stir to coat well
recipeInstructions.name: Add cooked corn to the bowl and stir to coat well

recipeInstructions.text: Add 2 tablespoons Cotija cheese and 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 2 tablespoons Cotija cheese and 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro. Mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve as is or with your choice of refried beans, guacamole, or sour cream.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve as is or with your choice of refried beans, guacamole, or sour cream.
